title: I have two computers, this one is brand new and my pass word is forgotten, what next
content: This is a new computer, I have Firefox on my 2nd computer (Wife's)and I cant rember my pass word, I have had to change multiple pass words in the last week and I am still having trouble with Telstra trying to get my Outlook going!
creator: me262a1

title: Task Reminders Not Working
content:
After I reinstalled Windows and reinstalled Thunderbird, task reminders no longer work. I create tasks using the New Task button on the Tasks tab with a due date and time in the New Tasks dialog. This used to result in a Reminders window popping up at the scheduled date and time. Now, however, nothing happens. As far as I can tell, all the settings on the new install of Thunderbird are the same as I had before. The screenshot shows what I used to get, and what I would like to get again.

Is some setting required to get a Reminders window?
creator: firefox1043

title: filtering & spam handling halts when accessing same imap account simultaneously from work & home
content:
I leave Thunderbird running on my computer at home to do filtering and to handle spam. My account is an IMAP account. When I access that IMAP account using the ISP's webmail interface while at work, it seems that -- often -- the filtering and spam handling on my home machine halts. This might be because I manually delete obvious spam and "should be filtered" emails using the the ISP's webmail interface. The Thunderbird app itself (at home) keeps running, though.

Has anybody else seen something similar? That is to say: Deleting messages on an IMAP account using the ISP's "native" webmail interface results in a separate instance of Thunderbird (running somewhere else, but at the same time for the same account) losing functionality? (not crashing outright, but filtering and spam handling stops)

TIA!

Home tech details: MacOS 15.3.1 (24D70) Thunderbird 128.7.1esr (64-bit)
creator: sinkva

title: Telstra email password
content:
My email account with Telstra was suspended following scam privacy issues. 

Telstra tech help then assisted me in setting a new password.  This password works with Telstra Webmail, but not with my preferred email Thunderbird.

I find the format of Thunderbird much easier and tidier than Webmail, and would like to continue receiving and sending my email through Thunderbird.

But despite many attempts to use my new password on Thunderbird, it will not recognise it. I would appreciate any help on the matter please.
creator: mabunn

title: Spostamento posizione barra dei menù e impostazione tipo caratteri
content: Salve, vorrei sapere se è possibile spostare la barra dei menù sotto la barra degli strumenti. Inoltre non mi è chiaro nel menù impostazioni>Generale> lingua ed aspetto la la voce "caratteri e e colori" in quali parti del programma va ad agire. Grazie per l'aiuto

title: Spostamento ordine cartelle
content:
Salve, è possibile spostare l'ordine di visualizzazione delle cartelle nell'albero di ogni singolo account? Ho visto che c'è un'estensione che permetteva di farlo ma non è compatibile con l'ultima versione di Thinmderbird.

Grazie a chi mi aiuterà.
creator: concorfra

title: Non invio email
content:
Buongiorno, da qualche tempo provo ad inviare l'email ma....si blocca riportando questo messaggio: Non è stato possibile inviare il messaggio perché la connessione al server in uscita (SMTP) non è riuscita. Il server potrebbe non essere disponibile o rifiutare le connessioni in uscita (SMTP). Verificare che le impostazioni del server in uscita (SMTP) siano corrette e riprovare.

controllato tutte le impostazioni più volte ma è tutto nella norma

grazie per il supporto
creator: alessandro.varese

title: uitzondering op berichtenfilters
content:
Omdat ik zoveel aanbiedingen krijg over energie heb ik een berichtenfilter gemaakt. Hierdoor worden echter ook belangrijke mail van mijn huidige energieleverancier verwijderd.

Mijn vraag is nu of het mogelijk is een afzender te selecteren zodat deze niet door het filter wordt verwijderd maar wel de ongewenste reclame?

Met vriendelijke groet,

M.Oosterhof
creator: oosterhofm

title: Messages show downloading, but do not show in inbox
content:
Thunderbird is shows "downloading 1, 2, 3... of 259", but the messages don't show in the inbox.

Background: I'm on Thunderbird 115.18.0 ESR. Gmail quit downloading pop, despite my having set "allow less secure..." I have a bunch of email accounts, and wanted to get just one working, so I set the others from "pop.gmail.com" to "xxxpop.gmail.com", just so they wouldn't all keep failing as I was testing. I got some message about a problem with folders that I didn't pay much attention to.

I finally realized I'm going to have to switch from "Normal Password" to "OAuth", which I did.

PROBLEM: When I get email, it authenticates and starts downloading 259 messages. Fine. But those messages don't show in the inbox.

I've tried to repair the folder, that made no difference. I tried compacting, that made no difference.
creator: allizom.frog4food

title: Server Disconnect Message
content:
I am running Windows 10 Home edition. My email account is for a domain I own on Dreamhost. When I click on a subfolder I get the message "Server imap.dreamhost.com has disconnected. The server may have gone down or there may be a network problem." I have my firewall set to allow thunderbird.exe traffic to pass. Any suggestions. I don't have this issue running K-9 on my Andriod phone. (I am reluctant to switch to Thunderbird on my Android phone until I solve this on my PC.

Any suggestions?
creator: garry18

title: Need help from an expert moving from Outlook. How to import PST/OST correctly with calendars and everything.
content:
Desperately in need of assistance. Been using Outlook for decades, but continual issues have forced me to move to another option. Been using Bluemail on my phone, but saw that Thunderbird supposedly functions more like Outlook without being the pain that is Outlook.

So, I was managing 6 different email accounts in Outlook and all were POP3, because I get a lot of client emails and need to store them for legal reasons. I end up with way too much data to keep out on IMAP servers.

Anyway, I installed Thunderbird and setup my personal business email on it as POP3 and that seems to be fine, but I need to also import my PST/OST backup of that account into Thunderbird so that I have access to all of the saved emails/calendar. I see places that tell me it can be done directly in Thunderbird and others that tell me I need a 3rd party app. Does Thunderbird not include an import or conversion option that will let me do it?

If I can get this to work, I will then need to do it for the other 5 accounts, and unfortunately soon, as some of my accounts are nearing their max storage size in IMAP while I try to solve this.

Thanks very much to anyone who can quickly and accurately assist me.

SMC
creator: SMCunningham
